revised_title: Hybridization and Developmental Stability in the Mus musculus Hybrid Zone
tldr: The study investigates fluctuating asymmetry in the Mus musculus hybrid zone and finds an increased developmental stability in populations with mixed genomes. The results suggest that the barrier to gene flow in the hybrid zone may result from the disruption of relatively few gene systems and challenge the relation between developmental stability, co-adaptation, and overall fitness.
